title: Ravens make 'tough decision,' cut kicker Tucker
content: The Ravens on Monday released kicker Justin Tucker, parting ways with the NFL's most accurate kicker who is being investigated by the league for sexual misconduct.

title: Atkinson wins Coach of Year in debut with Cavs
content: Cleveland's Kenny Atkinson, who watched from the sideline as Donovan Mitchell, Darius Garland and Evan Mobley had All-Star seasons for the Cavaliers, has been named the NBA Coach of the Year after leading the team to 64 wins and the top seed in the East.

title: Top 2026 QB Curtis chooses Georgia over Oregon
content: Five-star passer Jared Curtis, the No. 1 quarterback in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to the Georgia Bulldogs over the Oregon Ducks Monday night, closing a fierce recruiting battle that sources told ESPN's Eli Lederman went "down to the wire."

title: Clips prez: Kawhi, Harden franchise's foundation
content: Clippers president Lawrence Frank said he definitely believes in Kawhi Leonard and James Harden as the franchise's cornerstones, despite an embarrassing Game 7 loss in their first-round series against the Nuggets.

title: Trump plan cuts funding for brain injury research
content: The Trump administration's budget request eliminates major federal funding for traumatic brain injury research and education, potentially undercutting efforts to address head injuries in sports.

title: Yankees' Cole on surgery: 'Starts out really dark'
content: Yankees pitcher Gerrit Cole has his mind is on clearing checkpoints in his recovery from elbow reconstruction surgery last month.

title: Pop 'getting better,' but time to pass Spurs' torch
content: Gregg Popovich spoke publicly for the first time since his stroke, saying he's "getting better by the day" but that "it's time" for Mitch Johnson to be the Spurs' coach.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Round 2 begins with Maple Leafs-Panthers Game 1
content: The 16-team playoff field has been cut in half. Here's what to watch next, along with three stars of Round 1.

title: UN Security Council Begins Closed-Door Talks Meeting On India-Pak Tensions
content: The UN Security Council commenced closed-door consultations here on the situation between India and Pakistan, hours after Secretary General Antonio Guterres voiced concern over tensions between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: "Refined Way Of Hawala Business": Top Court On Trading In Bitcoin In India
content: The Supreme Court on Monday said trading in Bitcoin in India is like "dealing with a refined way of Hawala business" as it lamented that the Centre has till now not come out with a clear regime on regulating virtual currency.

title: India Lodges Protest With Canada Over "Unacceptable Imagery" At Parade
content: India on Monday lodged a strong protest with Canada over the "threatening language" and "unacceptable imagery" targeting Indian leadership at a parade held in Toronto.

title: India-Pakistan Tensions Highlights: Centre's Civil Defence Drill Order, Key Meets At PM Office
content: The Centre has asked several states to conduct civil defence drills on Wednesday amid tensions with Pakistan after the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam on April 22.

title: Top Court Issues Notice To Centre On Plea Against Blocking 4PM YouTube Channel
content: The Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to the Union government on a plea filed by journalist Sanjay Sharma challenging the directive to block the YouTube channel 4PM News Network on grounds of "national security" and "public order".

title: Aviation Ministry Gives In-Principle Nod For Airports In Rajasthan, Odisha
content: The civil aviation ministry on Monday granted in-principle approval for greenfield airports in Rajasthan's Kota and Puri in Odisha.

title: Must Avoid Military Fight That May "Spin Out Of Control": UN To India, Pak
content: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres Monday voiced concern over tensions between India and Pakistan being at "at their highest in years" and called for "maximum restraint and stepping back from the brink".

title: Centre Asks For Security Drills In States Amid J&K Tensions, First Since 1971
content: The Centre has asked several states to conduct security mock drills on Wednesday, May 7, for "effective civil defence" amid tensions between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, sources told NDTV.

title: Video: Israel Bombs Yemen's Hodeidah Port Day After Houthi Strike On Airport
content: Israel has bombed Yemen's Hodeidah port, a day after the Iran-aligned Houthis fired a missile that struck near Tel Aviv's main airport.

title: "Designed To Operate Against...": India Tests Advanced Underwater Naval Mine
content: India successfully conducted validation trials of an indigenously designed and developed multi-influence ground mine (MIGM) and an advanced underwater naval mine designed to operate against modern stealth ships and submarines.

title: India Does Not Have The "Luxury": Think Tank Contests World Bank Views On Growth
content: India does not need to follow the traditional approach to development that ties it with per capita income, new research has suggested.

title: India Intervenes As Hong Kong Set To Auction Buddha's Sacred Jewels
content: The Ministry of Culture on Monday said it has sent a legal notice to Sotheby's in Hong Kong, asking the auction house to immediately halt the upcoming sale of the Buddha's sacred jewels and return the artefacts to India.

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Nikola Jokic and why this should be an epic, polite MVP clash
content: Both players have had historic, unprecedented seasons. Gilgeous-Alexander could win his first MVP, Jokic his fourth -- but neither is keen to campaign for it.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: Reshuffling all 32 teams after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: NFL experts debate the draft: What were the best -- and most puzzling -- picks?
content: Great value on Malaki Starks? Reach on Isaac TeSlaa? We asked 17 experts to weigh in on the NFL draft.

title: Five-star QB Jared Curtis to Georgia: How he fits and what's next
content: Jared Curtis, the nation's top QB recruit has made his decision. Here's what the move means for the teams and the 2026 class.

title: Who will kick for Ravens after Justin Tucker release? A look at his likely successor
content: After drafting the Arizona kicker in the sixth round, the team will likely turn to Tyler Loop after releasing Tucker on Monday.

title: Chelsea-Liverpool lessons, Napoli close to Serie A title, Bayern clinch Bundesliga, more
content: Chelsea beat Liverpool, Napoli moved closer to another Serie A title, and Bayern Munich clinched the Bundesliga without playing: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Sources: Madrid want Alexander-Arnold for CWC
content: Real Madrid want Trent Alexander-Arnold to join them for this summer's Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN, and now plan talks with Liverpool to negotiate his early release.

title: Kane targets trophy 'number two' after title win
content: England striker Harry Kane said it feels sweet to finally end his career-long trophy drought after securing the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich

title: Mourinho silent on future as Fener title hopes fade
content: José Mourinho refused to confirm whether he will remain at Fenerbahce next season after Sunday's defeat to Besiktas left them adrift in the title race.

title: Kroos: Pedri 'more important' to Barça than Yamal
content: Former Real Madrid player Toni Kroos believes Barcelona's Pedri is the best midfielder in the world and more important to his team than Lamine Yamal, Robert Lewandowski and Raphinha.

title: Mac Allister: Liverpool 'just getting started'
content: Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister hopes winning the Premier League title this season is "just the beginning of something great."

title: CAS to rule in León's Club World Cup dispute
content: A verdict is expected Tuesday in Liga MX club León's legal dispute with FIFA over entry to the Club World Cup in the United States next month.

title: Inzaghi: Inter must stop Yamal to reach final
content: Intern Milan coach Simone Inzaghi said his side must stop quick thinker Lamine Yamal if they are to reach the Champions League final.

title: Palmer hits back at online 'idiots' as Chelsea win
content: Cole Palmer hit back at social media "idiots" after ending his goal drought in Chelsea's 3-1 win over Liverpool on Sunday.

title: Warren Buffett To Stay As Berkshire Hathaway Board Chair After Leaving CEO Post
content: American investor Warren Buffett, 94, will remain as chairman of Berkshire Hathaway's board of directors once he steps down as chief executive at the end of this year, the conglomerate announced Monday.

title: 15-Year-Old Raped Twice In Moving Car In Faridabad: Cops
content: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly raped twice in a moving car here while she was on her way to school, police said Monday.

title: Auto Driver Jumps Into Yamuna River After Argument With Landlord In Delhi
content: A 49-year-old auto driver jumped into the Yamuna River from a flyover here following an argument with his landlady whom he was ferrying, police said on Monday.

title: Over 25 Cats Found Dead In US House After Neighbours Report Unpleasant Odour
content: The Bohemia Fire Department reached the house for investigation when they saw dozens of cats roaming freely, living in filthy and overcrowded conditions.

title: Man Accused Of Providing "Question Paper" Ahead of NEET Exam In Bihar Arrested
content: The police arrested a person from Bihar's Araria district for his alleged involvement in duping medical aspirants ahead of the NEET-UG held on May four across the country.

title: Naveen Patnaik Revamps BJD, Brings Back Political Affairs Committee
content: After assuming the charge of the party president ninth time in a row, BJD president and five-time Odisha chief minister Naveen Patnaik Monday revamped the regional party and brought back political affairs committee (PAC).

title: US Offers $1,000 And Pay For Travel To Migrants Who Self-Deport
content: The Trump administration said Monday it will pay for the travel and give $1,000 to undocumented migrants who "self-deport" back to their home country.

title: Day Of Key Meets At PM Office As India Prepares Pahalgam Response: 10 Facts
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a series of key meetings this evening as India calibrated its response to the massive terror strike in Kashmir's Pahalgam. Russia has offered "full support" to India in its battle against terrorism.

title: Miami GP showcases F1's youth movement, American popularity
content: From the drivers in the cars to the fans in the stands, young people made F1's Miami GP yet another success.

title: A.J. Brown's proposal to girlfriend includes performance by John Legend
content: The Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver will don his second ring in a several month stretch after helping the Eagles win Super Bowl LIX in February.

title: Overhyped and underdelivered: Only one fighter gets an A from highly-anticipated weekend
content: From Ryan Garcia to Naoya Inoue, Andreas Hale looks at the top fighters to compete last weekend and grades their performances.

title: West Virginia football unveils throwback uniforms that pay homage to 1965 team
content: The threads, unveiled Monday, will feature tweaks to the team's usual color scheme and a modern version of the helmets worn by the 1965 squad.

title: Grading MLB's City Connect uniforms: Snakes launch best look of 2025
content: From the pastel Padres to the Motor City Tigers and beyond, we break down MLB's City Connect uniforms.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers, Stars are favorites to hoist Cup
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Kirst, Kavanagh or English? Paul Carcaterra's big board for the 2025 PLL draft
content: ESPN's Paul Carcaterra ranks the 2025 PLL draft's top prospects and matches teams up with players who best fit their needs.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Waiver wire: Why settle for one rising star when you can have two?
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: MLS: Vancouver remain top; Seattle, Philadelphia soar up
content: The Vancouver Whitecaps continue to dominate the top spot in the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eyeing move for Sané
content: Barcelona are reportedly looking to sign Leroy Sané when his contract expires. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Pakistani hackers claim to have breached many Indian defence sites
content: Cyber-attacks originating from Pakistan have escalated, targeting Indian defense entities. The website of Armoured Vehicles Nigam Limited (AVNL) was defaced, and hackers claim to have accessed sensitive data from the Military Engineering Services (MES) and MP-IDSA. Authorities are taking measures to bolster security, audit systems, and enhance digital defenses against further intrusions.

title: India to soon get 2nd advanced stealth frigate built in Russia
content: India's naval power is set to increase with the imminent commissioning of INS Tamala, a stealth frigate from Russia, following its sister ship INS Tushil. The Navy and DRDO successfully tested indigenous underwater mines, enhancing undersea warfare capabilities. These advanced Krivak-III class frigates, equipped with Brahmos missiles and other weapons, will bolster India's blue water operations.

title: Flushing & desilting used as tools to cut water flow to Pakistan
content: Following the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty, India has initiated flushing and desilting of reservoirs on the Chenab River to improve water storage for the winter months. This action is part of a broader strategy to regulate the flow of western rivers into Pakistan. India also plans to expedite hydropower projects and explore additional measures to maximize water utilization.

title: SC: Trend of ED making allegations against accused without evidence
content: The Supreme Court has raised concerns about the Enforcement Directorate (ED) making unsubstantiated allegations in money laundering cases, highlighting a pattern of lacking evidence to link accused individuals to proceeds of crime. This observation arose during a bail hearing for an accused in the Chhattisgarh liquor scam, where the court questioned the ED's evidence linking the accused to a specific amount of illicit funds.

title: First since 1971: MHA orders nationwide security drills to prepare for any attack
content: Amid rising tensions with Pakistan, the home ministry has directed all states and UTs to conduct civil defence drills across 244 districts on Wednesday. This large-scale exercise aims to enhance preparedness against potential attacks, simulating wartime scenarios to test evacuation plans, communication systems, and the functionality of civil defence services. The drills will involve civilians, students, and volunteers, focusing on training and assessing operational coordination.

title: Ray Dalio says Donald Trump’s tariff war is pushing America close to a recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: In call to PM Modi, Putin backs India, says no compromise on terror
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin, in a call with PM Modi, strongly condemned the Pahalgam terrorist attack, emphasizing the need to bring perpetrators and supporters to justice. This endorsement of India's stance comes amid international calls for de-escalation. Putin accepted Modi's invitation to visit India for the annual summit, reaffirming the strength and resilience of the India-Russia strategic partnership.

title: No stay, next CJI B R Gavai to decide waqf Act validity
content: CJI Sanjiv Khanna has passed the decision on the validity of the Waqf Amendment Act, 2025 to incoming CJI B R Gavai, scheduling a hearing for May 15. The decision came after the court reviewed the Centre's response, noting the need for detailed examination of waqf property registration and related figures. The government maintains the Act benefits the Muslim community, while petitioners have raised concerns.

title: Amid Pak's reckless missile tests, Japan backs India's war on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh conveyed to his Japanese counterpart General Nakatani India's concerns regarding Pakistan's continued support for cross-border terrorism and its role in nuclear proliferation, which threatens regional stability. Both nations condemned terrorism and pledged to enhance global cooperation to counter cross-border threats, with Japan expressing solidarity with India following the Pahalgam attack.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on Twitter; changes his profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Rajasthan govt plan to rename Mt Abu, ban booze and non-veg, sparks protests
content: Rajasthan government's plan to rename Mount Abu as 'Abu Raj Tirth' faces strong opposition from 23 local organizations, fearing a shift from a tourist destination to a religious site. Stakeholders worry that the proposed name change, coupled with potential restrictions on meat and alcohol, could collapse tourism and lead to mass unemployment. Concerns are rising about the hill station's identity and its attractiveness to visitors.

title: India conveys its concern to Canada over anti-Hindu rally
content: India has expressed strong concerns to Canada regarding a parade in Toronto featuring anti-India imagery and threatening language. The Indian government urges Canadian authorities to take action against anti-India elements promoting hatred, extremism, and separatism. This issue continues to strain bilateral relations despite India's willingness to collaborate with the new Canadian government.

title: Pahalgam attack should not derail governance and development in J&K: Omar
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah emphasized that the Pahalgam terror attack would not impede governance and development in Jammu and Kashmir, echoing the central government's sentiment. He resumed office in Srinagar, prioritizing action, accountability, and inclusive development. Abdullah highlighted the importance of a smooth Amarnath Yatra and the anticipated inauguration of the Kashmir rail link to boost the region.

title: Elon Musk seems to have neighbourhood problem in Texas, where he ...
content: Elon Musk is embroiled in disputes with his Texas neighbors over his compound plans. Complaints include zoning violations, excessive security measures like high fences and cameras, and alleged harassment. A homeowners association head, Paul Hemmer, has been particularly vocal, claiming constant surveillance and indecent behavior accusations.

title: ‘Orders reserved for eternity’: SC asks HCs for pending cases data
content: The Supreme Court has expressed serious concerns about high court judges delaying judgments indefinitely, violating the right to speedy justice. It directed all High Courts to provide details of cases with reserved judgments pending pronouncement before January 31. Following this directive, Jharkhand HC promptly delivered verdicts in long-pending appeals, acquitting convicts, and scheduled orders for other delayed cases.

title: Punjab govt says Nangal Dam police deployment linked to India-Pak tension
content: Amidst a water release dispute with Haryana, the Punjab government justified its deployment of a large police force at the Nangal Dam by citing heightened India-Pakistan tensions following the Pahalgam terror incident. This explanation was presented to the Punjab and Haryana High Court, which is hearing petitions from the Bhakra Beas Management Board (BBMB) and others regarding Punjab's actions.

title: BSF incited flare-up in Murshidabad: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has blamed BSF for instigating the Murshidabad violence, alleging their firing on protesters led to subsequent deaths. She criticized the BJP for focusing on Murshidabad while ignoring Manipur and other troubled states. Banerjee accused the BJP of hiding the riot victims' families to prevent her from providing compensation and using them to criticize her.

title: Pahalgam attack: Mehbooba slams closure of tourist spots, detention of locals
content: Mehbooba Mufti has strongly criticized the government's decision to close tourist destinations in Kashmir following the Pahalgam attack, highlighting the negative impact on tourism and local livelihoods. She voiced concern over the widespread detention of locals, including vendors and ponywallahs, and cautioned against collective punishment and the alienation of the Kashmiri people. Mufti urged financial assistance for tourism-dependent workers ahead of the Amarnath Yatra.

title: Ahead of Shambhu stir, farm leaders put under house arrest
content: In anticipation of planned protests, Punjab Police conducted a crackdown, placing farm leaders under house arrest and detaining others. This action, endorsed by Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann, aims to prevent disruptions to public life caused by road and railway blockades. The move has sparked criticism and a call for further protests, escalating tensions between the government and farm organizations.

title: Now, Odisha threatens to sue over ‘dham’ in Digha
content: A dispute has erupted between Odisha and Bengal over the naming of a newly inaugurated Jagannath temple in Digha as "Jagannath Dham," with Odisha threatening legal action. Bengal's Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee retaliated, accusing Odisha of jealousy and targeting Bengalis. The conflict has ignited social media campaigns and accusations of discrimination against Bengali-speaking people in BJP-governed states.

title: Allahabad HC disposes of petition challenging Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
content: The Allahabad High Court's Lucknow bench dismissed a PIL questioning Rahul Gandhi's citizenship, advising the petitioner to pursue other legal options. The court cited the Union government's inability to provide a timeline for resolving the complaint. A BJP worker alleged Rahul held British citizenship, making him ineligible to be an MP, but the Centre awaits information from the UK government.

title: Delhi airport’s closed runway to open today
content: Great news for air travelers as Delhi Airport's main runway 10/28 is set to reopen this Tuesday. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has approved the reopening after inspecting the upgraded runway. This move aims to alleviate the massive flight delays and diversions experienced recently. However, the runway will be closed again from mid-June to mid-September 2025 for further work.

title: Targeted because of cobbler's son, SC reinstates Punjab judicial officer
content: The Supreme Court condemned caste-based discrimination within the judiciary, highlighting the targeting of a judicial officer in Punjab due to his lower caste origin as a cobbler's son. The court upheld the Punjab and Haryana High Court's decision to reinstate Prem Kumar, an additional district and sessions judge, who was unfairly dismissed.

title: Poonch terror hideout busted, tiffin-box IEDs seized
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district have successfully dismantled a terrorist hideout in the Surankote area, recovering a cache of IEDs concealed in tiffin boxes and steel buckets. The operation, conducted by a joint team, also led to the seizure of wireless communication equipment and other materials. This discovery has thwarted potential terrorist attacks in the region, prompting ongoing search operations.

title: CUET-UG 2025 put off, exams to begin from May 13 instead of May 8
content: The CUET-UG 2025, now starting May 13, faces delays and communication gaps, causing anxiety among 13.5 lakh applicants. The NTA will conduct the exam entirely in CBT mode for all 37 subjects. City slips, containing exam dates, are expected soon, as candidates prepare for a condensed schedule, with English and the General Test being the most popular subjects.

title: Thrice rejected for MBBS, disabled to get entry to AIIMS
content: The Supreme Court intervened in the case of Kabir Paharia, who was previously deemed ineligible for MBBS due to his disability. After multiple rejections, the court ordered AIIMS, New Delhi, to grant him admission in the 2025-26 session, citing a violation of his fundamental rights. The court also directed the National Medical Commission to revise disability assessment guidelines, emphasizing functional ability over the extent of disability.

title: Russia to fete former Odisha CM Biju Patnaik for role in Stalingrad op
content: The Russian Embassy in New Delhi will honour former Odisha CM Biju Patnaik on Victory Day, commemorating the Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany. Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov invited Naveen Patnaik to the event, where External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will be the chief guest. Biju Patnaik is recognized for his participation in the Stalingrad Operation and support to the Red Army during World War II.

title: After govt announces Rs 5L ex gratia, dead Jamshedpur patients get sudden kin
content: Following a tragic hospital balcony collapse in Jamshedpur that claimed three lives, individuals are emerging to claim government compensation, despite the deceased being abandoned during their lives. Hospital staff report that David Johnson, Lukas Tirki, and Srichand Tati had no visitors, but now relatives are appearing, seeking the bodies and the ex gratia payment.

title: SC refuses to entertain PIL against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's outburst
content: The Supreme Court declined a PIL seeking action against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey for allegedly criticizing the CJI and SC. The bench stated it would issue a short order explaining the dismissal. Another PIL concerning tourist safety in J&K after the Pahalgam attack was also dismissed, with the court criticizing the petitioner's motives and accusing him of seeking publicity.

title: Four held for nomadic woman’s ‘rape-murder’ in J&K
content: In a shocking incident near Nishat, Srinagar, a nomadic woman was allegedly raped and murdered, triggering widespread outrage. Police have arrested four men suspected of the heinous crime, which occurred while the victim was grazing her goats. Political figures are condemning the act, highlighting concerns about substance abuse and demanding justice for the victim and her family.

title: In major exam-security boost, UIDAI tests face ID at NEET-UG
content: UIDAI successfully tested Aadhaar-based face authentication for NEET UG 2025 in New Delhi, in collaboration with NIC and NTA. This pilot project marks the first use of facial biometrics in a major Indian entrance exam, aiming to enhance security and verify identities contactlessly.

title: Cash at judge's house: Panel submits report
content: A judicial panel submitted a report to CJI Sanjiv Khanna regarding the alleged cash discovery at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence following a fire. The inquiry, triggered by the mysterious disappearance of cash captured in a video, involved examining over 50 witnesses, including top Delhi officials.

title: Pakistan test-fires missile amid escalating tensions with India
content: Pakistan's military recently conducted successful test launches of its Fatah and Abdali missiles, showcasing enhanced precision and range amid regional tensions. These tests, part of Exercise INDUS, aim to validate technical parameters and ensure operational readiness. The actions underscore Pakistan's commitment to bolstering its defense capabilities in response to perceived threats and escalating tensions with India.

title: India makes Chenab run dry, for now
content: Following a terror attack and the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty, India has restricted water flow from the Baglihar and Salal dams on the Chenab River. This unprecedented action led to dramatically low water levels, allowing residents to walk across the riverbed for the first time in memory. The move highlights India's ability to regulate water resources and has sparked debate over the treaty's impact on the region.

title: Selection panel 'differs', CBI chief may get 1-year extension
content: CBI Director Praveen Sood is likely to receive a one-year extension, amidst indications of disagreement within the selection committee, comprising PM Modi, CJI Khanna, and LoP Gandhi. Sources suggest the Congress leader hasn't approved any potential successors. Sood's initial two-year term concludes next month. Several senior IPS officers, including Sanjay Arora, Manoj Yadav, and Kailash Makwana, are being considered.

title: IIT-Kharagpur relaxes rules after suicides
content: Following a series of student suicides, IIT-Kharagpur is considering easing academic pressures. The institute plans to reform its attendance policy to better balance student well-being and academic demands. This decision comes after the recent deaths of multiple students, prompting a review of policies that may contribute to student stress.

title: ACB digs up Rajasthan MLA's Rs20 lakh bribe buried in lawn
content: Rajasthan ACB recovered ₹20 lakh bribe money from Indira Gandhi Nagar, a day after BAP MLA Jaikrishn Patel's personal assistant fled with it during an entrapment operation. The cash, allegedly from a mine operator, was buried under a lawn. Patel, arrested on Sunday, is now in ACB custody for two days.

title: Court: Mental illness no bar to custody unless danger to kid
content: A sessions court in Mumbai upheld a magistrate's decision to grant temporary custody of a 16-year-old son to his mother, dismissing the father's appeal. The court emphasized that a parent's mental illness doesn't automatically disqualify them from custody unless the child's welfare is endangered. The judge prioritized the child's welfare and noted the magistrate's thorough consideration of the case, including interaction with the child and mediation efforts.

title: SC summons comedian Raina & 4 others over demeaning PWDs
content: The Supreme Court has taken a stern view of the misuse of free speech to mock individuals with physical disabilities. The court summoned comedian Samay Raina and four other influencers following a PIL accusing them of denigrating the dignity of the physically challenged on online platforms.

title: Landslide strikes Kempty Falls amid U’khand deluge
content: Uttarakhand experienced an alarming surge in rainfall, exceeding normal levels by 490% in the last 24 hours, with some areas surpassing 1,000%. The excessive rain caused Kempty Falls to swell, triggering landslides that blocked highways and damaged property. Authorities have issued red and orange alerts for several districts, prompting disaster management to prepare for potential emergencies and halt pilgrimages.

title: SC allows DGP to oversee SIT in Badlapur death case
content: The Supreme Court modified a Bombay High Court order, directing Maharashtra's DGP to supervise the SIT probing allegations against policemen in the Badlapur 'fake' encounter case. This case involves the custodial death of Akshay Shinde, accused of sexual assault. The SIT will be constituted by the DGP, who will select appropriate officers for the investigation, with the state CID required to hand over relevant documents within two days.

title: Sambhal: ASI files survey report, HC fixes May 13 for next hearing
content: The Archeological Survey of India (ASI) submitted a survey report to the Allahabad High Court regarding the Jama Masjid and Harihar temple dispute in Sambhal. The court has adjourned the case for the next hearing on May 13, extending the stay on trial court proceedings. The dispute centers on claims that the mosque was built after demolishing a temple.

title: Cop becomes 1st ‘candidate’ acquitted in Vyapam case
content: In a significant setback for the Madhya Pradesh STF, a CBI court in Bhopal acquitted Sajan Singh Thakur, a police constable, in the Vyapam scam. Thakur was accused of using a proxy in the 2013 recruitment test, but the court cited inconclusive forensic results and lack of evidence. This marks the first acquittal of a candidate in the massive exam fraud case, raising questions about the prosecution's case.

title: SRH vs DC: Sunrisers officially knocked out of IPL 2025 playoff race
content: Persistent rain led to the abandonment of the match between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Delhi Capitals. DC, after a top-order collapse, recovered to post 133/7, thanks to Stubbs and Sharma's partnership. Cummins' impressive bowling spell put DC under early pressure. SRH are now out of the playoff race, while DC moved to fifth place.

title: What Xi's Moscow visit won't show: The Chinese dying for Russia
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping will visit Russia soon. This visit occurs amidst reports of Chinese nationals fighting in Ukraine, mostly for Russia. Some fighters are returning with harrowing experiences. Ukraine accuses China of supplying Russia with war materials. China denies any state involvement. The situation poses a challenge for Xi, balancing support for Russia with avoiding direct military engagement.

title: Warren Buffet: I am somewhat embarrassed to say Apple CEO Tim Cook ...
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, acknowledged Tim Cook's role in Berkshire Hathaway's success. He credited Apple's CEO for significant financial gains. Buffett announced his retirement at the annual meeting. This marked the end of an era. Greg Abel, the vice chairman, is set to succeed Buffett. Abel will lead Berkshire with a focus on long-term value.

title: Bihar polls will be the first test of the call to defeat BJP: CPI(M)‘s M.A. Baby
content: In Bihar, the party general secretary says the Mahagathbandhan alliance in the State has already begun united and serious preparations to achieve the goal

title: Odisha govt clarifies no timber from Puri’s Jagannath shrine used in Digha temple
content: A controversy has been simmering over allegations that surplus sacred timber from the Jagannath Temple in Puri was used to carve idols for the new Jagannath Temple in Digha

title: ‘Why such envy against Jagannath Temple’: Mamata Banerjee slams ‘baseless’ neem wood theft charge
content: The Bengal Chief Minister also expressed concern over reports of attacks on Bengali-speaking migrant workers in Odisha and said that they are targeted for speaking in Bengali

title: UNSC begins closed door consultations on situation between India, Pakistan
content: Hours before the closed consultations, UNSG Antonio Guterres voiced concern over tensions between the countries being at ‘their highest in years’, saying ‘it pains me to see relations reaching a boiling point’

title: Parachutes for uncrewed spaceflight of Gaganyaan mission flagged off
content: Developed indigenously by the ADRDE, the sequential system of parachutes is designed for Gaganyaan programme tests which are planned for later this year

title: India conveys concerns in ‘strongest terms’ to Canada after pro-Khalistan rally in Toronto
content: A large pro-Khalistan rally was taken out on May 4 that used terms like ‘Kill India’ and depicted several leading figures including PM Modi in a derogatory manner; the rally also raised slogans on religious lines and sought expulsion of Canadians of Indian origin

title: Detaining non-citizens and the rule of law
content: Assam’s immigration detention regime is not just a threat to the liberty and well-being of those caught up within it; it also raises important questions of constitutional principles

title: India carries out test of advanced underwater naval mine
content: The MIGM is designed to enhance the Indian Navy's capabilities against modern stealth ships and submarines

title: Speeding of bulletproof vehicle led to minor accident in Nadda’s convoy: T.N. Police
content: The Tamil Nadu police appeal to those travelling with VIPs not to pressure the drivers of bulletproof cars to speed

title: Delhi govt may hold meeting on May 6 to discuss preparations for mock drills
content: Measures to be taken during the drill include operationalisation of air raid warning sirens and training of civilians on civil defence aspects to protect themselves in the event of a ‘hostile attack’, govt sources said

title: More cyberattacks from Pakistan-based groups come to light
content: The ‘X’ account ‘Pakistan Cyber Force’ states that the group has allegedly gained access to sensitive data from Indian Military Engineering Service (MES) and Manohar Parrikar Institute of Defence Studies and Analysis (MPIDSA), defence source in the know says

title: Activists ask Centre to withdraw genome-edited rice varieties, say it’s unsafe
content: Venugopal Badaravada, a member of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research’s (ICAR) governing body representing farmers, said the announcement reflects a troubling trend of prioritising ‘science-for-headlines’ over ‘solutions-for-the-farm’.

title: Lufthansa, Air France, others avoid Pakistan airspace amid tensions
content: Pakistan’s overflight fee earnings are expected to be impacted by the loss in revenue, putting a financial strain on an already low on foreign currency reserves State Bank of Pakistan.

title: Jammu and Kashmir Government to respond to Sinha’s objections over proposed business rules soon
content: The Transaction of Business Rules is aimed at defining the functioning and jurisdiction of the Lieutenant-Governor, the Chief Minister and the Council of Ministers in the Union Territory

title: Akhilesh hits out at plan to use cow dung-based paint on govt. buildings in Uttar Pradesh
content: SP leaders alleged that such actions were aimed at diverting the attention of the masses, and hiding the failures of the State government

title: Family of captured BSF jawan hopeful of swap with detained Pakistani ranger
content: Hours after the terror attack in Kashmir’s Pahalgam, Pakistani forces detained the BSF constable after he reportedly dozed off under a tree in Pakistani territory along the international border in Punjab’s Ferozepur.

title: Comprehensive insurance scheme for KSRTC employees
content: Employees need not pay premium for scheme. KSRTC will be fully computerised to allow passengers to buy tickets using UPI and card transactions on all KSRTC buses

title: CBI Director Praveen Sood likely to get one-year extension as selection panel fails to reach consensus
content: The committee, headed by PM Modi and having CJI Sanjiv Khanna and LoP in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi as members, met on May 5 evening at the Prime Minister’s Office

title: Tribal girls’ insistence on reporting gang-rape brings attention, development to Maoist-hit village in Madhya Pradesh
content: Officials of the district administration, police officers, and politicians have been visiting the Duglai village in Madhya Pradesh’s Balaghat district every day since the crime was reported

title: Jairam Ramesh cites Dhankhar’s comments to take swipe at Modi
content: “If the same money is transferred directly to farmers, then each farmer household in India could receive at least ₹30,000 per year,” the RS Chairman said

title: Collective punishment is not how democratic society responds to tragedy: Mehbooba Mufti
content: PDP leader visits Pahalgam, calls for fair treatment of civilians and seeks financial help for pony wallas ahead of Amarnath yatra

title: Pahalgam terror attack: India-Pakistan tension at its ‘boiling point’, says UN chief
content: In one of his strongest such statements thus far, he cautioned that both countries must avoid a military confrontation that he said could easily “spin out of control”

title: BJP Northeast in-charge Sambit Patra meets Meitei and Kuki-Zo representatives in Manipur
content: Mr. Patra’s visit comes days after 21 Manipur Members of Legislative Assembly (MLA) wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, urging them to form a “popular government” in the State

title: Allahabad High Court disposes of petition seeking CBI probe into Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
content: The matter pertains to a plea filed by S. Vignesh Shishir, who had petitioned the court to order the CEC, the Chief Electoral Officer of Uttar Pradesh, and the Returning Officer of Raebareli to cancel the Congress leader’s electoral certificate

title: 3,000 SHG women to operate 700 Trupti canteens in State: MA&UD Minister
content: MA&UD Minister Ponguru Narayana inaugurates first Trupti Canteen in the state at Atmakur Bus Stand Centre in Nellore on Monday

title: Post Indus treaty hold, India triggers untimely water release from J&K dams
content: While such release of water — called ‘flushing the reservoir’ — is a routine, annual activity and necessary to clear the dams of riverine silt and muck to keep the power plants linked to these reservoirs running optimally, it is usually done in August, during the monsoon.

title: Smoke emanates from Kozhikode MCH again, patients evacuated
content: On May 2, 151 patients were shifted following after a minor explosion on the ground floor of the same building. Minister admits to lapse in readmitting patients to the building without adopting proper safety measures

title: Tight security in place for Thathayagunta Gangamma temple jatra
content: The Gangamma Jatara, is known for its vibrant and unique traditions, has gained attention across India after the Telugu film ‘Pushpa – The Rule’

title: 500 homestays identified in tribal, heritage, rural areas as part of sustainable tourism initiatives in A.P.
content: The move is a part of the State’s vision to empower local communities while celebrating its rich cultural, tribal, and ecological identity, says Tourism Department

title: A dream come true for tribal families in Amboori as Kumbichal Kadavu bridge becomes a reality
content: 1,450 families living in the tribal settlements in Thodumala and surrounding areas to benefit from bridge completed at ₹24.71 crore from KIIFB funds

title: Government, online companies spar in Supreme Court on GST over games of skill, chance
content: Centre contends that betting or wagering on any kind of game, whether chance or skill-based, is gambling

title: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy urges employee unions to understand the poor finances left behind by the BRS
content: Who Are You Fighting?, CM questioned Unions, highlights ₹30,000 crore support to farmers in 16 months

title: Viksit Kerala key to achieving Viksit Bharat: Governor
content: Governor presents Business Excellence Awards 2025 instituted by Trivandrum Chamber of Commerce and Industry

title: New study reveals how lion-tailed macaque strategically uses its habitat amidst increasing human pressures
content: A study of two lion-tailed macaque troops, one in buffer zone and another in the core zone of the National Park, showed different behavioural patterns

title: Bengal LoP offers ‘safe house’ to family members of Murshidabad lynching victims
content: This comes after the family alleged that police broke open the doors and barged into their premises in Kolkata, where they had come to file a petition before the Calcutta High Court demanding a CBI probe into the murder of two of their family members.

title: Prakasam police bust notorious inter-district gang of thieves
content: The police officials have arrested three thieves and recovered ₹85 lakh worth gold and silver ornaments, 6 kg marijuana and a car from them

title: Rajeev Chandrasekhar wangled an official invitation to Vizhinjam port commissioning: Govindan
content: CPI(M) plans many programmes on June 29, the 50th anniversary of Emergency, to honour those who resisted the Congress government’s constitutional overreach

title: SC survey: Hassan Deputy Commissioner appeals to public to cooperate
content: District administration has appointed 1,968 enumerators, one each for every 150 households, and they will make door-to-door visits to collect data on a mobile app, says DC Sathyabhama

title: Mango farmers in NTR district face losses as pest attack, unseasonal rains hit yield
content: Three episodes of unseasonal rains in the first two weeks of April, the harvesting time, resulted in heavy fruit damage and drop, say ryots

title: Harvested paddy procurement to be completed in 2 days, says Minister
content: 60,374 metric tonne of second crop procured from 24,969 farmers in the district. In the first crop, the total paddy procured was 74,348 metric tonne from 33,792 farmers

title: Will provide 20 lakh jobs by setting up industries: Bharath
content: The Industries and Commerce Minister, along with Panyam MLA Gouru Charitha Reddy, district Collector P. Ranjith Basha and others, inaugurates the ₹38.47 crore MSME park set up at Guttapadu village in Orvakal mandal

title: Stanley Cup playoff picks: Who wins every second-round series?
content: the first round of the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs is complete . eight of the teams that made the postseason bracket have moved on, and eight others have been eliminated . ESPN's experts have identified their picks for each matchup .

title: Rangers turn to Bret Boone as new hitting coach
content: former big league infielder Bret Boone hired as hitting coach for the Texas Rangers . it will be the first time Boone is on a major league coaching staff . he will join the Rangers on Tuesday for the opener of their three-game series .

title: 👀 Best of 2025 Met Gala's red carpet
content: the 2024 Met Gala has officially kicked off in new york city . some of the biggest sports stars are in attendance . athletes have made headlines at the annual fundraising event in previous years . the 2025 Met Gala features a strong presence behind the scenes .

title: This time at UCF, Scott Frost won't need to catch lightning in a bottle
content: Scott Frost is reuniting with the UCF Knights as their new head coach . the Knights are now in a power 4 conference, and there is now a 12-team college football playoff . he is a new coach at the university of central Florida .

title: How Liverpool move on from Alexander-Arnold
content: mark Ogden wonders if Trent Alexander-Arnold's best chance of success on the pitch is at Liverpool . the 26-year-old has announced he will leave the club when his contract expires at the end of the season . he revealed he feels like he needs a new change and a challenge for him as a player .

title: NBA playoff odds: Pacers close gap on Cavaliers after Game 1 win
content: defending champions Boston Celtics and the new york Knicks are favorites to win the Eastern Conference . early favorites for Finals MVP include Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Jayson Tatum and Donovan Mitchell . the Golden State Warriors beat the Houston Rockets on the road in Game 7 .

title: College baseball Week 12: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: Coastal Carolina jumped up five spots, making room for the USC Trojans to be ranked for the first time this season . the longhorns were swept on the road by Arkansas, and the Tigers dropped six sports to no. 9 . they remain no. 1 for another week .

title: 2026 recruiting class top 25 rankings: Georgia debuts after landing five-star QB
content: it has been nearly a decade since USC has signed a top-five class . the Trojans have yet to make an appearance in the college football playoff . but Lincoln Riley is working to change the fortunes on both those fronts .

title: Follow live: Knicks head to Boston for Game 1 of East semifinals
content: Content extraction failed.

title: Where all 30 MLB teams stand -- and what each of them needs to change
content: Xavier Scruggs explains why the Cubs might need to be worried about their pitching . every team, no matter how splendid or how dreadful the start, has something to change . the national league looked top-heavy, and the overall dynamic is very much one of dominance .

title: The most astounding numbers of Aaron Judge's torrid start to 2025
content: Aaron Judge is hitting an astounding .423/.510/.777 with 10 extra-base hits during his eighth-inning double Sunday . he leads the majors in batting average, on-base percentage, slugging percentage, OPS and hits .
